author: Anonymous Comp
title: Variable vs Function Error
question:
In particular, when I am trying to write a command to return a certain characteristic of an image (e.g. image-height), and I have defined a variable img as a particular image (for example, let's say it's a circle with a height of 20), I get the code:
(image-height(img))
Which leads me to this error:
function call: expected a function after the open parenthesis, but found a variable
However, if I were to turn this input into a function by changing the input to a function that produces an output identical to the circle. It works. I get the code:
(image-height(rotate 0 img))
Which does work in returning the height of the image.
While this method works, I'm a bit confused as I'm pretty sure there should be a more intuitive way to do this.
student_answer: You do not need brackets around img.
